DOC.brief_summary: Introduction : The increase intermuscular adipose tissue ( IMAT ) contribute muscle weakness consequently progression knee OA . The prescription exercise protocol use treatment strategy minimize bout . Circuit training ( CT ) involve combination strength training aerobic session show benefit body composition physical function . But literature unclear respect influence CT concentration IMAT population knee OA . DOC.detailed_description: This study present randomize controlled trial design . They select 40 participant diagnose knee OA grade II III , age 40 65 year BMI < 30 kg / m2 randomly divide two group : participant underwent training ( train group - TG ) subject training ( untrained group - NTG ) . The participant train group undergo periodized CT protocol 14 week load progression , 3 time week , session last 15 minute first week arrive 35 minute final week , add 10 minute heat cooling . All subject conduct pre post CT variable : IMAT thigh ( compute tomography ) ; body composition ( Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry - DXA ) , inflammatory biomarker concentration : IL-1β , IL-6 , IL-10 , TNF-α , leptin adiponectin joint degradation biomarkers ( uCTX-II sCOMP ) , performance test functional ( six-minute walk , 30 second chair stand test stair climb test ) , muscle strength ( maximum voluntary isometric contraction - MVIC ) , WOMAC KOOS questionnaire , catastrophizing pain scale . During train protocol , uCTX-II variable , sCOMP MVIC also evaluate . To compare group apply unpaired t-test . When find significant main effect , Bonferroni test use identify statistically significant difference . To compare collection time ( pre , post TC ) uCTX-II variable , sCOMP MVIC hold repeated measure ANOVA post hoc Bonferroni , WOMAC variable , KOOS , DXA , IMAT , functional test inflammatory cytokine ( pre post CT ) hold paired test . A significance level 5 % ( p ≤ 0.05 ) adopt .
